results.title: Canada: landform regions
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sidney Goldsmith, Frank Spiller and Eugene Boyko
results.brief_description: A view of Canada from a helicopter, showing the nature and extent of the various landform regions. We see the immense spread of forest, rock and lakeland that makes up the Canadian Shield, the plains and lowlands where the industry of man is more evident, and finally, the coastal mountain ranges of the west, north and east. The influence of the geological character of the land on what people do and where they live is illustrated in closer views of industry, urban and rural, across the country. Photography: Eugene Boyko. Award: Sydney

results.title: Canada wild
results.creator_credit: Grainger Maynard, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: This adventure records the superb wildlife and wilderness of outback Canada, beginning in the stunning Queen Charlotte Islands, the Galapagos of North America. We sail past foraging bears, whales, raccoons, seals and sea lions, catching Coho Salmon in the land Haida Indians. The action then moves to the Rocky Mountains with a spectacular horse trek and white water rafting in the famous raging rapids. We then travel to Baffin Island in the Arctic Circle to hunt caribou and seal with the Inuit Indians - the Canadian Eskimos. It is a wonderful journey through the beautiful and remote Canadian wilderness.

results.title: Canada vignettes: Log driver's waltz
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and John Weldon
results.brief_description: A young girl who loves to dance and is ready to marry chooses a log driver over his more well-to-do, land-loving competition. Driving logs down the river has made him the best dancing partner to be found. This lighthearted, animated tale is based on the song The Log Driver’s Waltz by Wade Hemsworth. Kate and Anna McGarrigle sing to the music of the Mountain City Four.

results.title: Canada on stage
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tim Wilson and John Howe
results.brief_description: Front-seat view of the annual Dominion Drama Festival in Vancouver’s new Queen Elizabeth Theater. Biggest affair of its kind in the world, the Dominion Drama Festival each year brings together the best of Canadian amateur theatrical talent. “Canada on Stage” shows you scenes from prize-winning performances during the week-long festival as Vancouver plays host to groups from all parts of Canada. Caught by the camera is the taut atmosphere after the final curtain as awards are announced by festival adjudicator Phillip Hope Wallace, British drama critic.

results.title: Canada in world war one
results.brief_description: Suitable for classroom use, this film shows World War 1 in the context of world developments before and since. It presents a vivid and authentic record of events from 1914 to 1918, in Canada and Europe. In this film, young Canadians see what they are asked to “remember” on November 11th. Written by Strowan Robertson and edited by David Green.

results.title: Canada calling
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, James Beveridge and David A. Smith
results.brief_description: An outline of Canadian radio activity. Commentator John Fisher briefly reviews the history of radio in this country and of the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation’s present three-network set-up. The variety of radio fare for Canadians is indicated by snatches of favorite programs; Trio Lyrique; Mart Kenney; the Toronto Symphony; the Happy Gang; forums; religious programs; drama; and old-time music. The variety of people involved in the business of broadcasting is described, and concluding sequences deal with the CBC International Service.

results.title: Canada's reindeer
results.brief_description: In 1935 a herd of 2,700 reindeer completed a five-year journey from Alaska to north of the Arctic circle. They were imported and re-settled by the Canadian Government in an effort to improve the economic conditions of the Inuit. This film is the story of the trek, the raising of reindeer for saleable meat, its effects upon the people and the transformation of herding from a primitive art to one using modern technology. The film shows how an ecologically sound, make-work project that started as a gamble ended up a success, generating jobs and money for the local people.
